    • Method Detail

      • clamp

        public static int clamp​(int value,
                        int min,
                        int max)
        Clamps a int variable between the given min and max values.
        Parameters:
        value - the variable to clamp
        min - lower bound
        max - upper bound
        Returns:
        value if min < value < max, min if value < min, max if value > max

      • clamp

        Returns:

      • lerp

        public static float lerp​(float first,
                         float second,
                         double amt)
        Linearly interpolates between first and second by amt. The parameter amt should be in the range [0, 1]. When t = 0, returns first. When t = 1, returns second. When t = 0.5, returns the midpoint of first and second. DoaEngine guarantees the result to be true if and only if the parameter amt is in the range [0, 1]. Parameter amt not being in the range [0, 1] is an undocumented behaviour and might give a wrong result. Use at your own risk!
        Parameters:
        first - start value
        second - end value
        amt - interpolation value between the two floats
        Returns:
        the interpolated float result between the two float values

      • lerp

        public static double lerp​(double first,
                          double second,
                          double amt)
        Linearly interpolates between first and second by amt. The parameter amt should be in the range [0, 1]. When t = 0, returns first. When t = 1, returns second. When t = 0.5, returns the midpoint of first and second. DoaEngine guarantees the result to be true if and only if the parameter amt is in the range [0, 1]. Parameter amt not being in the range [0, 1] is an undocumented behaviour and might give a wrong result. Use at your own risk!
        Parameters:
        first - start value
        second - end value
        amt - interpolation value between the two doubles
        Returns:
        the interpolated double result between the two double values

      • map

        public static float map​(int value,
                        int sourceRangeMin,
                        int sourceRangeMax,
                        int destinationRangeMin,
                        int destinationRangeMax)
        Re-maps a number from one range to another. Value not being in the range [sourceRangeMin, sourceRangeMax] is an undocumented behaviour and might give a wrong result. Use at your own risk!
        Parameters:
        value - the incoming value to be converted
        sourceRangeMin - lower bound of the value's current range
        sourceRangeMax - upper bound of the value's current range
        destinationRangeMin - lower bound of the value's target range
        destinationRangeMax - upper bound of the value's target range
        Returns:
        Re-mapped number

      • map

                        float sourceRangeMax,
                        float destinationRangeMin,
                        float destinationRangeMax)
        Re-maps a number from one range to another. Value not being in the range [sourceRangeMin, sourceRangeMax] is an undocumented behaviour and might give a wrong result. Use at your own risk!
        Parameters:
        value - the incoming value to be converted
        sourceRangeMin - lower bound of the value's current range
        sourceRangeMax - upper bound of the value's current range
        destinationRangeMin - lower bound of the value's target range
        destinationRangeMax - upper bound of the value's target range
        Returns:
        Re-mapped number
